posts.title: HOW TO INSTALL FREE CAD  on WINDOWS, MAC OS and LINUX (and what is FREE CAD)
posts.body:
FREE CAD

"what is FREE CAD"

>FreeCAD is a parametric 3D modeling application. This application is made primarily for modeling real world objects, such as small electronic components and civil engineering project buildings, with 3D printable objects. FreeCAD is free to download, use, distribute and modify, and its source code is open and published under a very permissive LGPL license. FreeCAD is a social project, as it is developed by a developer community that craves them for FreeCAD.
Manual will guide you through the same information available on the wiki. However, based on examples, and a more integrated tone given by a number of authors, will make it more suitable for first contact with FreeCAD. Manual is written for the latest stable version of FreeCAD which version 0.16.
All book contents are published under a Creative Commons 4.0 license, and may be used freely, downloaded, copied, and modified. The source files of the manual are hosted on the wiki, and on the original github accounts are used to write the first version of the book. It's easier to read HTML, PDF, MOBI and EPUB versions available on GitBook. we have two main ways to view the documentation : >1.by exploring the user hub
2.by following the manual. This is a well-executed piece of work, written and developed by the FreeCAD user community.

for user hubs

contains useful documentation for FreeCAD users in general: because here there is a list of all workbenches, instructions on how to install and use FreeCAD apps, tutorials, and everything you need to get started.

for Power user centers

here is documentation for advanced users. there is also a macro storehouse, instructions on how to install and use apps, and more information about FreeCAD.

for developer hubs

contains material for developers, such as how to compile FreeCAD, how the FreeCAD source code is structured and how to navigate in it, how to develop new workbenches, or embed FreeCAD. the backbone of the offline documentation that ships with the FreeCAD application. ![Screenshot (127).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmRBiCVQ2LKGt6knWXfAqMR2mfHxoF9zKCDpDNDhaGMWKu/Screenshot%20(127).png) ![Screenshot (129).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmbgwfBmqbrMJGJZmTyQ5nVH6dY9ccSqBywyAHPtUX8s17/Screenshot%20(129).png) ___

"Manual installation"

FreeCAD uses the LGPL license, so we can freely download, install, redistribute and use FreeCAD as we see fit. One thing that is prohibited by the license is to claim that we are programming FreeCAD itself. FreeCAD has no difference in Windows, Mac OS and Linux. However, there is little difference how to install it. In Windows and Mac the FreeCAD community provides precompiled packages (installers), whereas in Linux, source code is available only to Linux distribution managers, and then responsible for packing FreeCAD for distribution. in Linux, we can install FreeCAD rights from the software manager application. we can download the official FreeCAD for Windows and Mac OS here : https://github.com/FreeCAD/FreeCAD/releases

how to install free CAD in windows

>

1.Download the installer package (.exe) and select the one that corresponds to our version of Windows (32bit or 64bit). The FreeCAD installer works from the Windows 7 version.
2. then, Double click on the downloaded installer.
3.we will accept LGPL license terms, click safely "accept" button.


![Screenshot (131).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmd3AeqE4FWjLfghDZK3aQy7FvrDRH9nXGJW4JDQTkp8Fk/Screenshot%20(131).png)
>

4. here we can leave the default path :


![Screenshot (133).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmRwjMpnGjQ2zne3WPdWELVrnGn8dBhcm2GjNatrZXG4t8/Screenshot%20(133).png)
>

5.We do not need to set the PYTHONPATH variable, unless we plan to do advanced python programming :


![Screenshot (135).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUnQuGeRyNzLx39imcBm1S1cfM6De4VsHfDi3y5hf5LhL/Screenshot%20(135).png)
>

6. when the installation process of some additional components bundled inside this installer will be installed as well :


![Screenshot (137).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmWctEGNZ7EDfVg7NCLKu73KeaeqJBVGZj6Y93BdUXZuPe/Screenshot%20(137).png)
>

7.and FreeCAD is already installed. we will find it in your start menu.


![Screenshot (139).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPrBknzhKJF1YCsFMH2B2Y6WZxgX5Rc96JvPvECuk1JZi/Screenshot%20(139).png)
to Install the development version FreeCAD and installer creation takes some time, so usually the development version is provided as .zip archive (or .7z). and keep in mind It does not need to be installed, we just extract them and lauch FreeCAD by double-clicking the FreeCAD.exe file that we'll find in it. It also allows us to keep the version stable and "unstable".

how to Install on Linux

In most distributions on modern Linux today (Ubuntu, Fedora, OpenSUSE, Debian, Mint, Elementary, etc.), FreeCAD can be installed by a single click on the button, directly from the software management application provided by the distribution. >

1.Open your device manager software and take steps to search for "freecad" :


![Screenshot (141).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmSqkc8PKMakUQtQRFasj9U72naszUFsKEwY9BMXchEBTN/Screenshot%20(141).png)
>

2.Next step Click "install" button, and FreeCAD is already installed.


![Screenshot (143).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmZWTXxFCyDHFcevzY2P4QRR715TW4NgRZWZvJi35Pz29e/Screenshot%20(143).png)
One of the advantages of using Linux is the abundance of possibilities to customize the software. In Ubuntu and its derivatives FreeCAD can be installed from PPA managed by the FreeCAD community and because it is open-source software, and we can also easily compile FreeCAD itself.

how to Install in Mac OS

Installing FreeCAD on Mac OSX is currently just as easy on other platforms as well. >

1.Download the zip package that corresponds to your computer version.
2. then Open the Downloads folder, and expand the zip file you have downloaded :


![Screenshot (145).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQLENhSBqyG6C2ofRMuUhqLqqu5ioUH5GqVJSbXKjpkUy/Screenshot%20(145).png)
>

3. then Drag FreeCAD applications from within zip into the Applications folder :


![Screenshot (147).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUp5UhZZ9b93Lsc3ugDc8YbbGRUd8a4TrXsS3x69aqoUa/Screenshot%20(147).png)
>

4.It's just that, FreeCAD is already installed and is usable.


![Screenshot (149).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmbqT83DscSMkFAhAieyTZ4iy2QobnrEkJwBPQHuGtuEFd/Screenshot%20(149).png)
>

5.If the system prevents FreeCAD out, we must first enable it in system settings :


![Screenshot (151).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmZnZSyyvgFgSUNECQoNMbD5KkbAjxTcB2rcWxCCgDjJC3/Screenshot%20(151).png)
___ ___ I would like to apologize to you and also to thank all visitors who have visited my writing and who have supported and participated to my blog in an intentional or perverted way, with your positive comments very helpful to my writing in the future. ![siap.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmVXDUJr2c9pZq5CQei6t6qm9N2ePsFwZyAzhUhc9P923p/siap.jpg)

posts.author: noisy
posts.title: What we can say about Steem users, based on traffic generated to SteemProjects.com after being 3 days on top of trending page.
posts.body:
Last week was for me really crazy :) After months of development I have finally deployed two of my projects, and one of them was _**on top of Trending Page for a long time**_...
[![top of trending page.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmVHeF7QszrtFcYdi3mKSdtPGAbFYUjbPWPKTADfuRjK5S/top%20of%20trending%20page.png)](https://steemit.com/steemprojects/@noisy/ann-introducing-steemprojects-com-information-about-all-steem-projects-in-one-place)
[[ANN] Introducing SteemProjects.com - information about all Steem projects in one place!](https://steemit.com/steemprojects/@noisy/ann-introducing-steemprojects-com-information-about-all-steem-projects-in-one-place)
_Personal Note: During my 21 months of being active Steemian, after writing 146 articles, that was my second post which ends up on the very top of Trending. Earlier I also had two post which also was quite popular, but didn't reach the top:_ |Post Title|Number of Votes |Number of Comments |Reward | |------|------------------------|-------------------------------|-----------| |[We just hacked 11 accounts on Steemit! ~$21 749 in STEEM and SBD is
under our control. But we are good guys 😇 So...](https://steemit.com/steemit/@noisy/we-just-hacked-11-accounts-on-steemit-1158-sbd-and-8250-steem-is-under-our-control-but-we-are-good-guys-so) |2300 |579 |$7520.61 | |[[ANN] Introducing SteemProjects.com - information about all Steem projects in one place!](https://steemit.com/steemprojects/@noisy/ann-introducing-steemprojects-com-information-about-all-steem-projects-in-one-place) |1995 |398 |$905.14 | |[How to increase a productivity as a software developer - part I, LiveCoding](https://steemit.com/programming/@noisy/how-to-increase-a-productivity-as-a-software-developer-part-i-livecoding) |279 |23 |$4773.19 | |[How I bankrupt my first startup by not understanding the definition of MVP
- Minimum Viable Product](https://steemit.com/programming/@noisy/how-i-bankrupt-my-first-startup-by-not-understanding-the-definition-of-mvp-minimum-viable-product) |313 |41 |$1827.89| # But this time was different... ... because this time I have an opportunity to analyze generated traffic in a more detail way, and everything because of the fact, that last post was about website https://SteemProjects.com/, on which I installed Google Analytics, which collects data anonymously. Basically, I assume, that majority of users during reading or after that decided to visit a website, to check it out. Since SteemProject started, it was viewed 23k times! ![Selection_346.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmeH7Z9hynHxEjkwr7rLj5ugTwmFH8zKjzZCUm377haS4v/Selection_346.png) I think this is quite representative data sample, so I assume, that analysis based on such traffic should reflect users, demography, and some other properties of Steem community. Would you like to learn how much users came to SteemProjects from Steemit.com and how much from Busy.org? Are you curious how much traffic single Tweet of @ned can generate? What about females vs. males? Or maybe you would like to find out what types of applications are the most popular among Steemians? If yes... please read the second part of this post, which was prepared for you by @lukmarcus. ------------------------------
All graphs were created based on Google Analytics from 5th to 13th March 2018 CET (UTC+1:00).
Let's start with something simple, like... how much traffic can generate entry on very top of Trending. The post was there for 2.5 days... what is clearly reflected in numbers. # Number of Users
![DQmYhED9KAhoL7LYsAP4JBb1Sx7zxGpokBs8Ra8ZvYsn5Vc_1680x8400.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUgQQCkQ7HtKpPJ7N6eK1nyCBuEVACrgCW56T9ompd9Ma/DQmYhED9KAhoL7LYsAP4JBb1Sx7zxGpokBs8Ra8ZvYsn5Vc_1680x8400.png)
Of course, the biggest traffic was in first days. What is very interesting, traffic from day 1 was almost the same as from 2nd that. We can see this even better when we change day into hours:
![DQmUXZprnU13Pi6zXjKYyP4VkZf2EQhCMCnFJENXcA1gdm1_1680x8400.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmNRqNExXWYsR818u8jjTprDK97QL3umgfAt5HqSScr9NC/DQmUXZprnU13Pi6zXjKYyP4VkZf2EQhCMCnFJENXcA1gdm1_1680x8400.png)
What conclusion can we draw from it? It looks like users of Steem are checking out Trending page every other day. Only some users, check it out every day (the 2nd day was slightly worse). After 2 days, most active users of Steem, was already familiar with this post. # Demographic Statistics With that amount of data, there are a lot of statistics about users that can be presented. For example, we can look at age and gender of new users:
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmTdJfrsZUDfdqf9sDw5VRRhdaz7fSxrGZaeAWLknM6KHw/users_age_gender.png)
It’s a little sad that only 10% are women but we must remember that Google Analytics registered age and gender of only about 1/3 of all new users, so that statistics can be really wrong. We have definitely more information about the origin of new users:
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmd2tmFnjNZZPQcoaW7vBJDBq9jueETS6uaLcQKMJPQVdR/users_countries.png)
There’s nothing strange in 1st place or 2nd (@noisy is Polish) but further ones are interesting like Indonesia, India or Nigeria. We can also look at users’ preferred browsers:
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmZEPwxDHde4T1HdtnHgW7QZ8P3GmkR19xKGd7bFVLboPH/users_browser.png)
Where Chrome has a devastating victory over all other browsers. There are also statistics about systems and types of devices:
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmNPZwKZTB8kHKsFwwXbKkvjGtM96H13iqzvsHGHg4zfpJ/users_system.png)
And we can clearly see that desktop Windows wins over Macintosh with Linux and mobile Android wins over iOS. For some people, next chart can be a little bit boring, but actually, this can give a clue to all Steem Developers, on which resolutions they should focus during development of own project.
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmccgsiRnvbFoGXhiAWraxCs9pmmnNeE4FZgNK9wpHZ92K/users_resolution.png)
And.. as you can see, your next project should have responsive UI, and should support a wide range of resolutions ;) # Sources of Visitors Now when we know what kind of users come to SteemProjects we can look into places where they come from. [Introducing SteemProjects.com](https://steemit.com/steemprojects/@noisy/ann-introducing-steemprojects-com-information-about-all-steem-projects-in-one-place) was published in Steem blockchain so people could saw it in many front ends.
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmfDgvF34uQHcaUAcDcA3tkAicRzfQCQdVEiuxB6uNQo7H/users_sources.png)
**Busy.org**, second most known interface of Steem, to put it mildly, was not very popular that day in comparison to **Steemit**. More popular referrers were: Google and Twitter. Single Ned’s [tweet](https://twitter.com/certainassets/status/970758862080004096) brought more new users (100) than whole Busy (95):
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmRjNZEBBYMRmK3KrdmnyiR3qLCBTxFTnCdvN8EnDw5djk/twitter.png)
Conclusion: We should try to use [alternatives of Steemit](https://steemprojects.com/categories/social-media/) more often. IMO, a project like Busy deserve to have much better stats. Most visits from Steemit were from introduction post but other users also wrote about SteemProjects. Let’s look at top 5 of them:
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPuBdm6VSuppNbBupQTSXxjEUfCc8xLCCBGpf2882zWV7/users_posts.png)
And here are the links: - @exyle: [Vlog 237: Steemprojects.com + different ways of earning STEEM today and in the future.](https://steemit.com/life/@exyle/r6xbc5cf), - @cryptoctopus: [Every Steem Apps Under One Roof - SteemProjects.com](https://steemit.com/steemprojects/@cryptoctopus/every-apps-of-steemit-under-one-roof-steemprojects-com), - @cryptoctopus: [Blockchan?](https://steemit.com/blockchan/@cryptoctopus/blockchan), - @impressable: [Steem Projects รวบรวมแถลงการณ์ล่าสุด เกี่ยวกับโปรเจ็คต่างๆใน Steem](https://steemit.com/esteem/@impressable/steem-projects-steem-24a264328e8ae), - @thewriting: [스팀잇과 스팀디(steemd)를 오가는 꿀팁](https://steemit.com/kr/@thewriting/steemd). One more time, thank you for mentioning SteemProjects in your posts! Finally, let’s have a look at grouped traffic sources:
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmSgM947A3537rQURRjaG9uZRac55tQXBc7jniccX9zB4A/users_channel.png)
# Content We know who, we know how many and we know from where. There are two things left: how long and what. For example, we can take average session time and use it with countries. Let’s sort it from the longest time with places with at least 5 new users.
![DQmRkpePq59Ubmvxkt6o2RYZixEJh7oEk3JPKdu7ARVsKmg.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmRkpePq59Ubmvxkt6o2RYZixEJh7oEk3JPKdu7ARVsKmg/DQmRkpePq59Ubmvxkt6o2RYZixEJh7oEk3JPKdu7ARVsKmg.png)
The United States with most new users is not even in top 20, but there is a place for Indonesia with higher numbers of people than other countries. This graph also shows that first 9 places belong to countries with 21 or fewer visitors. What is so interesting on SteemProjects that people wanted to see? What they were looking for? We will start with categories:
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmU8Qk59Jko9yyNyYAkBQ2ZgtxFrATv7evm6dNijMJW41y/views_categories.png)
Look at those numbers! Bots had the biggest interest and we all know why. On SteemProjects you can also find compares, where you can look at different options on few similar projects at the same time.
![ ](https://steemitimages.com/DQmZaD53LjsLjvQKaaK7WDsdK3dyjpYQ8qsJyp5iKS29GWj/views_compares.png)
And although Account Creation Tools was on 2nd place in categories, creation account is 1st on compares. # What are the most popular projects in Steem ecosystem? Well... you will be able to learn more about that from our future blog posts :)
posts.root_title: What we can say about Steem users, based on traffic generated to SteemProjects.com after being 3 days on top of trending page.

posts.author: perduta
posts.title: Game that I fall in love with as developer
posts.body:
### TL; DR
Couple months ago I discovered RTS game about programming creep units to make decisions instead of the player in the online world. 24/7.

*BTW. Hello, this is my first post and it's kind of storytelling about part of my life.*

### Me playing stupid games before - #introduceyourself
I like to play games. A lot. Unfortunately, my weak dexterity and slow reflexes made me really low player when I needed to [agressivly click on your keyboard and spam your mouse](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/) (tho I have enjoyed this). After years of wasting my programming skills down there, I came up with idea of botting games that I play, which gave me a lot of fun and opportunities for growth in my coding skills when I need to inject into some other process and change its memory on the fly to control character and work around my lack of "Being A True Player". The end of this kind of stuff was always the same, getting banned for something that between gamers is widely considered as cheating.

![](http://i.imgur.com/9TaWVje.gif)

### First time when I'm allowed to program strategy instead of wasting my time
When I have discovered Screeps for the first time I was amazed. Game not only allowed me to play the game as I liked, but it forced every other player to do the same. The full strategic game, that gives you API to move your StarCraft-like units/buildings and runs your JavaScript code on its servers all time, from dusk to dawn. It's all about being the best smartass that does the best code and gets the best strategies done in low CPU and memory usage.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0DtltU9ozHI

### My contribution
Since I'm playing for a while now, I decided to let my source code of Screeps be open to other players, which can be accessed [here](https://github.com/patrykperduta/screeps). There are also a couple of repositories that can be widely used as "helping tools" created by [organization called Screepers](https://github.com/screepers), that I'm proud of belonging to.

### Take your chance
As every game in an early stage, what this one needs most are the players! At this moment there are 1354 players that I have to fight with, which is way to easy to be on top of high score table! Take your chance and dig into the world of Screeps. I challenge you. One day you may win: "*The world's first
MMO strategy sandbox game for programmers*".
posts.root_title: Game that I fall in love with as developer

posts.author: cryptoctopus
posts.title: SteemProjects.com - A Project We Should All Care About + Suggestions
posts.body:
![steem1.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmc9TGq251MaH6U7PCKy2NLuf3o8oTbGmTdESrxBPeAH61/steem1.png)

So many things are going on with the Steem Blockchain that is hard to keep up with everything. One project, above all others, is tackling this issue right now and that's SteemProjects.com by @noisy and his team.

**I'm writing this for two main reason:**

1. I want to encourage everybody to bookmark and visit this website often
2. I want to stimulate conversation about certain features that would make the website more interesting.

## Why SteemProjects Matter & Why We Should Care

Like I said above, too much is happening and the only place that is capable of updating itself **by the community** is steemprojects. Other websites have attempted to compile the apps on the steem blockchain but because this type of task requires a lot of updates, none were capable of keeping a somewhat comprehensive list of working apps.

With SteemProjects, we have the framework to build something that keep itself updated through community input.

Another reason to care about this project is because it is the best marketing tool one can hope to showcase this blockchain.

## My Suggestion

Most people who use a website, won't use github to give feedback and updates. There are many apps on the website that are no longer working and the team can't be the one to do all the heavy lifting of checking every single apps in the directory...or expect people to go to steemprojects.com github.

Please allow the community to give feedback on the status of a project.

Example:

1. Is this app currently working?
2. Is this website trusted?
3. Does this website implement SteemConnect?

#### Basically...Turn It Into a Review Website

For developers and users sake, please implement a review system. There would be tremendous good that could come out of it. Not only will you get the devs to care more about their steemprojects page but you will also allow for users to find the best apps ranked by how much users enjoy using it. 

Those reviews could be written directly via your website and then put on the steem blockchain...from there, people could be rewarded for providing feedback and reviews on all those projects. 

## Conclusion

If you have any other suggestions for steemprojects.com by @noisy, I'm do my best the upvote the best in the comment section.
posts.root_title: SteemProjects.com - A Project We Should All Care About + Suggestions

posts.author: nmax83
posts.title: SteemProjects.com - Sebuah Proyek Yang Seharusnya Kita Semua Peduli Tentang + Saran
posts.body:
![image](https://img.esteem.ws/7726hj0iej.jpg)https://goo.gl/images/SutyU6

Begitu banyak hal yang terjadi dengan Chainchain Steem yang sulit untuk bersaing dengan semuanya. Satu proyek, di atas semua yang lain, sedang menangani masalah ini sekarang dan itu SteemProjects.com 

**Saya menulis ini karena dua alasan utama:**

1. Saya ingin mendorong semua orang untuk menandai dan sering mengunjungi situs web ini
2. Saya ingin merangsang percakapan tentang fitur-fitur tertentu yang akan membuat situs web lebihmenarik.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/dhswjfgm55.jpg)https://goo.gl/images/XNKKFX

**Mengapa SteemProjects Matter & Why We Should Care**

Seperti saya katakan di atas, terlalu banyak yang terjadi dan satu-satunya tempat yang mampu memperbarui sendiri oleh komunitas adalah steemprojects. Situs-situs lain telah mencoba untuk mengkompilasi aplikasi di steem blockchain tetapi karena jenis tugas ini membutuhkan banyak pembaruan, tidak ada yang mampu menyimpan daftar aplikasi kerja yang agak komprehensif.

Dengan SteemProjects, kami memiliki kerangka kerja untuk membangun sesuatu yang terus diperbarui melalui masukan komunitas.

Alasan lain untuk peduli dengan proyek ini adalah karena ini adalah alat pemasaran terbaik yang dapat diharapkan untuk memamerkan blockchain ini.

**Saran saya**

Kebanyakan orang yang menggunakan situs web, tidak akan menggunakan github untuk memberikan umpan balik dan pembaruan. Ada banyak aplikasi di situs web yang tidak lagi berfungsi dan tim tidak dapat menjadi orang yang melakukan semua pengetesan berat untuk memeriksa setiap aplikasi di direktori ... atau mengharapkan orang untuk pergi ke steemprojects.com github.

Izinkan komunitas memberi umpan balik tentang status proyek.

**Contoh**

1. Apakah aplikasi ini saat ini berfungsi?
2. Apakah situs web ini dipercaya?
3. Apakah situs web ini menerapkan SteemConnect?

**Pada dasarnya ... Ubah Ini Menjadi Situs Web Ulasan**

Untuk pengembang dan demi pengguna, harap terapkan sistem peninjauan. Akan ada kebaikan luar biasa yang bisa keluar darinya. Anda tidak hanya akan mendapatkan devs untuk lebih peduli tentang halaman steemprojects mereka tetapi Anda juga akan memungkinkan bagi pengguna untuk menemukan peringkat aplikasi terbaik dengan seberapa banyak pengguna menikmati menggunakannya.

Ulasan tersebut dapat ditulis langsung melalui situs web Anda dan kemudian diletakkan di steem blockchain ... dari sana, orang dapat diberi imbalan untuk memberikan umpan balik dan ulasan pada semua proyek tersebut.
posts.root_title: SteemProjects.com - Sebuah Proyek Yang Seharusnya Kita Semua Peduli Tentang + Saran

posts.author: tanata
posts.title: Man Of Steel
posts.body:
![Screenshot_1.jpg](https://gateway.ipfs.io/ipfs/QmfZC2MBcb9KARU2qG8ofVck7ZKCBFG6WHVorH9AWwwMze)

I don’t know if I have the film to blame or the jackasses kicking the back of my seat through-out, but I have a splitting headache……

If the blame goes to Man of Steel, I’m going to blame it solely on the fact that there was too much action and not enough story. Can too much action in a superhero film ever be a bad thing, though? Well for me, I’m gonna have to say YES.

Man of Steel is a reboot to the Superman series very much the same way as the Batman films were. The planet Krypton is imploding and a child who could very well be the last of a civilization is shot into space to avoid the same fate as the rest of his people. That baby is named Cal-El and his shuttle crashes on a small farm on planet Earth. Raised as one of us by the couple who found him, Cal-El (given the name Clark Kent by his adoptive human parents) discovers what God-like powers he possesses and thus becomes Superman.

I’m just going to skip a few things (I feel the movie did this anyway) and get right to the things I didn’t like. Let me start with the pacing.

https://cnet2.cbsistatic.com/img/zT2Je-UsWcuTjVMBbDlCI17uyUk=/936x527/2013/06/13/4579f547-63d5-11e3-94dc-14feb5ca9861/man-of-steel-superman.jpg

Baby Supes crash lands on Earth and we quickly cut to him in present day, helping a crew man a ship through a storm. Throughout the whole of Clark Kent’s introduction to audiences, we see flashbacks of Clark as a kid doing extraordinary things. That’s fine, that’s great, but before you know it, he’s wearing the Superman suit and flying into space.

The use of flashbacks and the constant jump through time in the film (it does this so much in the beginning that I wasn’t sure if Clark’s first encounter with Louis Lane was a memory or in present time) comes across as lazy to me. I wish the story of Clark growing up was more linear and straightforward, leading up to him becoming a man - and in turn leading up to him becoming Superman. His beginnings on Earth seemed lazy to me to put all in flashbacks scattered around in the film. It screams “Let’s cover as much as we can, as quickly as we can!”.

And when Clark puts on the suit for the very first time, it’s way too early. There’s no buildup to that moment, making it incredibly flat while the backdrop escalates into a pulsating score. You’re sitting there thinking…….”Already?”. We were given so little time to spend with Clark Kent before he buckles up as Superman, that I felt like I didn’t really know him. Just that he was from another planet, is super strong, and he used to get picked on (like most kids in these types of movies, big whoop). We needed to spend another 15 minutes AT LEAST with Clark just being……..human.

I wanted to see him at home, more of his life at work, what he does around town, etc…..There’s a scene after he takes on the Superman mantle where he visits a church - I would have loved to have seen Clark visiting the church before, maybe have him questioning his faith and purpose in the world. Have him establish a relationship with the priest so that the Superman vs. Jesus Christ parallel would been much stronger. Unfortunately, a lot of the emotional investment we could’ve had with the character is missing due to this rush in pacing. I wanted - no, we NEEDED - more of a character driven story with Clark Kent. We got some of that, but not enough.

https://www.dccomics.com/sites/default/files/GalleryComics_1920x1080_20180530__MOS_1_5ae2232d9044b1.94368827.jpg

Another thing I didn’t like was his relationship with Lois Lane. They meet, Clark saves her life, and besides an interrogation scene afterwards, there really isn’t enough quality time spent between the two of them alone. Amy Adams is fine in the role, but it’s a part that anyone could have played. There wasn’t really much for her to DO. I feel her scenes were cut and pasted into a series of events rather than displaying an organic relationship blossom between her and Clark on screen. By the end of the movie, I didn’t care if they became friends or not.

And please, PLEASE, stop with the shaky cam. I’m tired of it. I don’t need to be so close to the carnage to feel how crazy and dangerous it is. I took my 3D glasses off a few times just so I could make out what was happening. We don’t need shaky cam all the time. It’s too much. If filmmakers like to use it here and there, FINE. But at every chance they can get? WHY? I like to see what’s going on in all 4 corners of the screen. We don’t need it when people are just talking to each other, either. It does absolutely nothing to enhance a conversation or acting. Nothing. STOP THE MADNESS.
Ok, enough bickering and whining, let me get to the stuff I did like: Henry Cavill. Great casting choice. The dude oozes such a quiet, humble confidence as Superman and he looks perfect - I mean peeeerfect - in the suit. His jet black hair, big blue eyes, and chiseled jaw gives him the commanding look, yet trusting presence someone of great power like Superman needs. He speaks in a very direct and calculated way. He also does this thing with his head where he’ll look down in thought, then snap it back up again as if he’s made a decision. It’s little details like that that I love watching actors do on screen. What I also appreciated was the fact that Henry’s portrayal as Superman was the same as Clark Kent. He didn’t change his demeanor, or voice, or do anything with his appearance (except shave. Thanks Gillette) to try and act any different than when he’s not wearing the suit. Which was great to see; I was afraid they’d write him in as having a big ego once he discovered who he was and how he chose to use his power in the world. I’m glad that they didn’t.

http://www.cheatsheet.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Amy-Adams-and-Henry-Cavill-in-Man-of-Steel.jpg

All the actors did well in their roles. Michael Shannon plays General Zod - our bad guy - and he is quite menacing. He’s so good, I kept thinking to myself “Why wasn’t he in the first Star Trek movie?”. He just wants to bring back his people, his world, but obviously at the cost of ours. His last scene with Superman was a really good one. His 2nd in command is also pretty sweet, played by Antje Traue. She’s so sinister looking but so attractive at the same time. She reminded me of Evil-lyn from the Masters of the Universe movie (which I looooove) and it occurred to me we haven’t really seen a bad girl like that in quite a while. Kevin Costner and Diane Lane were the perfect match for Clark’s adoptive parents. And I know it’s become “cool” to hate on Costner, but he was quite good in this. And who can forget Russell Crowe? He was in it more than I realized. Crowe plays Superman’s real father Jor-El and he’s once again in prime control of his directive as an actor. Love watching that guy on screen.

I also loved the music. It was big, loud, epic, and cued all in the right moments. Most of all, it was catchy. It had a rhythm to it that you could hum along to. I find in a lot of these superhero movies the music is just a bunch of noise exploding into a bunch of none sense. That wasn’t the case here.

The action was phenomenal (when you could see what was happening). Superman and bad guys being flung around like rag dolls destroying everything in their path. Crashing through buildings, flying through walls, being pounded into the ground - you name it, they did it. So much so, as aforementioned, I may have developed a splitting headache from the damn thing. At some point during all the buildings tumbling over and cars being whipped into the air I thought, “How are they going to top this in the sequel?”. They go all out.

In the end, as a revamped origin story, the action is big and the characters are strong, but the story itself isn’t given enough meat to satisfy this hungry camper. The little bits we got were good, we just needed more of it. Good thing Man of Steel is really entertaining and action-packed from start to finish, and Henry Cavill nails the role into the ground.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FLB3mK_t9kE

### My Rating: 7/10 

![1000x96_generator.gif](https://gateway.ipfs.io/ipfs/Qmb7KUBzcqGquN9WcYaP7cdxPk4nrDx8YecM4v7kReN5jJ)

posts.author: noisy
posts.title: Public and Private Keys - How to generate all Steem user's keys from master password, without a Steemit website, being OFFLINE
posts.body:
I had a break in writing technical articles, because I need some time to organize two Steem Meetups (in [Wrocław](https://steemit.com/steemit/@noisy/the-first-polish-steem-meetup-took-place-20-steemians-met-in-one-place-or-pl-odbyl-sie-pierwszy-polski-steem-meetup-20-steemian) and [in Warsaw](https://steemit.com/polish/@noisy/we-would-like-to-invite-you-to-join-first-steem-warsaw-meetup-or-pl-zapraszamy-wszystkich-na-pierwszy-warszawski-steem-meetup)), and to [give a talk about Steem in Łódź](https://steemit.com/steem/@noisy/today-i-am-going-to-talk-about-steemit-on-blockchain-lodz-meetup-in-poland). But finally I am back on track regarding my _Steem Security_ series, so today I am able to publish 3rd articles from this series. If you didn't read my earlier articles about different aspects of security of your steem account, you can find list of those articles on the bottom of this article. ![part3.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUnkuLWLAu4QvzHdnDPxJcME9D7M8RKZdXD9jJkxzSypn/part3.jpg) # Real password and keys: demo So, last time we learnt about why private keys are needed. This time we will learn how they are generated. You already have seen [in my 1st post in a series](https://steemit.com/security/@noisy/what-is-the-difference-between-a-password-and-a-private-key-s-on-steemit-how-to-make-your-account-more-secure-by-using-them) a demo gif/video, where I showed how to login to an account with a private key instead of a password. During this demo I also showed, that at the time of recording I used password `P5KB2ir4BaDTeeBe5SUW16F6NYGeYSVaUBn261kDPLGGCSiNahtm` to log in on my `noisy3`demo account. https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://steemitimages.com/DQmXk2iWwD272ETE9mesTnk5Hb1qMkUdZjUxRa7j9ZjHwPK/2017-06-11-17-59-28.gif Now I want to show you, that you actually **don't have to type your master password on Steemit website**, to generate all your keys. You can generate them being totally offline! # How to locally generate all Steem users keys from master password With some help of python code and [steem library](http://steem.readthedocs.io/en/latest/), we can write something like this: from steembase.account import PasswordKey account = 'noisy3' password = 'P5KB2ir4BaDTeeBe5SUW16F6NYGeYSVaUBn261kDPLGGCSiNahtm' key_types = [ 'posting', 'active', 'owner', 'memo', 'foo_bar' ] for key_type in key_types: private_key = PasswordKey(account, password, key_type).get_private_key() public_key = private_key.pubkey print('Private ' + key_type + ' key: ' + str(private_key)) print('Public ' + key_type + ' key: ' + str(public_key) + '\n')
This gives us: Private posting key: 5JLMze1sUVPhUBwTVjZyQhFMGfbN5KB7nqHfKjXuN5GUTYTbYFy Public posting key: STM6GkXgEKTYc7gNv1GWJ5ZseyESHQnN7nr3rxdo5sBjzWQcdMyKy Private active key: 5JFfMWjWMjnhu6vJKB2uUwUaLCws9JotHzLB8wkVEZjsZnSzDTv Public active key: STM5uLTFYpPK4XVLMe16uuQFdW1Vo2MzN9UPqHQKjePwB76NnS9qk Private owner key: 5JKjBjfRVZaf8H5w8XgiB6HfEH2SFJXUJL3QA6mteg5uQ3qRW9M Public owner key: STM7iZnny8bvNRd6v6nx25XG6ijAKZs1ANvtuqTN2gjSYWXHC8Jgy Private memo key: 5JvpThC3DwjHkupj6jnT5pnFW21Bsj3g4GhxhLLtM2WNsV2ynPw Public memo key: STM5uEy2yYnoqVY9ksfkMbbY3UH4qFygARn2SW7PFJ4cRErHbH7Vh Private foo_bar key: 5KJQP53B4MPHCWBQ8Xm9ydhKmjqrouRuf8UWWEZjHtkgmrtNCc5 Public foo_bar key: STM7hNqe6DJmXsqaDG8poaDVAvQx59EgWWQUbVLRUfi2Ab7mCvsnJ So as you can see, **private posting key** is exactly the same like in my demo gif/video above: ![Selection_999(271).png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmTB5EaWHKqguZ8jgXrj9RB64ANPSTUhAbuozSafmGtSVW/Selection_999(271).png) From technical point of view, from your password can be generated even new type of keys, like _Private `foo_bar` key_ and _Public `foo_bar` key_ :) ---------------- This article belongs to series of articles which describes security on Steemit: 1. [What is the difference between a password and a private key(s) on Steemit? How to make your account more secure, by using them correctly.](https://steemit.com/security/@noisy/what-is-the-difference-between-a-password-and-a-private-key-s-on-steemit-how-to-make-your-account-more-secure-by-using-them) 2. [Public and Private Keys - how they are used by Steem, making all of these possible?](https://steemit.com/security/@noisy/public-and-private-keys-how-they-are-used-by-steem-making-all-of-these-possible-you-can-find-answer-here) 3. [How to generate all Steem user's keys from master password, without a Steemit website, being OFFLINE](https://steemit.com/security/@noisy/public-and-private-keys-how-to-generate-all-steem-user-s-keys-from-master-password-without-a-steemit-website-being-offline) (this article) 4. [How to set own password, which is not generated by Steemit](https://steemit.com/security/@noisy/how-to-set-an-own-password-which-is-not-generated-by-steemit) 5. How passwords are stored by Steemit in your browser, and why it is secure. 6. How to setup multisig/multiple authorities for your account 7. ... Make sure to follow my account, if you don't want to miss any of these :) PS. [This article was live-st(r)eemed](https://www.twitch.tv/noisypl).
